tner,	
relations	and	friends	–	as	
they come to terms with 
the fact that your baby has 
additional needs. More 
than anything else at this 
time, you will need to talk to 
people about how you feel 
as well as about your baby’s 
health and future.
Your own GP, a neonatologist 
or paediatrician at your 
hospital, or your health visitor 
can all help you. You can also 
contact your social services 
department for information 
about local organisations that 
may be able to help. 
Help and support
